class TriggerTimer< ItemBox >

Detailed Description

Represents a drawable object which displays any kind of item. It's possible to specify an item renderer to customize the look.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ItemBox::ItemBox (   ) 
 

If the default constructor is used, the parameters have to be provided by using the method Init.

ItemBox::ItemBox (  Control *  control,
Item *  item
) 
 

Parameters:
control Parent control where the item box is embedded. Usually the parent control is an instance of the class Window.
item Item which should be displayed. Changing the properties of this item automatically leads to a redrawing of the item box. If no dispatcher has been set for the item, the item box will be set as dispatcher automatically.

Reimplemented from Component.

Item* ItemBox::GetItem (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns a pointer to the item which is embedded by the image box. Setting a property of the item automatically leads to redrawing of the item box.

const AbstractItemRenderer* ItemBox::GetRenderer (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the renderer which is used for drawing the item. Per default 0 is returned, which means that the the icon or the text of the item is drawn centered inside the bounding rectangle of the item box.

item Item which should be displayed. Changing the properties of this item automatically leads to a redrawing of the item box.

BOOLEAN ItemBox::SetProperty (  ResourceParser &  parser,
const GuiObjectFactory::PropertyId  prop_id
) 
 

Used by ARAGON to set the properties of the item box out of a resource file. It should not be necessary for the application developer to invoke this method in a direct manner.

Reimplemented from DrawableObject.

void ItemBox::SetRenderer (  const ItemRendererProperties *  properties = 0  ) 
 

Sets the renderer which is used for drawing the item. To keep the resource demand low per default no renderer is set. In this case the icon or the text of the item is drawn centered inside the bounding rectangle of the item box. The item renderer is specified by the renderer properties and can be configured inside the method GuiEngineConfig::ObtainItemRenderer.

Parameters:
properties Item-renderer-properties which are used by the renderer. If 0 is passed, no renderer will be instantiated. To use the default item renderer use GuiEngineConfig::GetDefaultItemRendererProperties() as parameter.
See also:
GuiEngineConfig::ObtainItemRenderer
